comment.author: 14578355@N02
comment._content: Is this possibly the dining room of the Musée d'Orsay museum?  Once the former railway station, the Gare d'Orsay.

comment.author: 11190727@N04
comment._content:
I think this is a cut crystal gallery. I see in the far right hand side a sign over that fellows head which reads in French: Crystallerie de P....
and some of these guys look like security guards except the one in the center who is more like a salesman.

comment.author: 83979593@N00
comment._content: Hi woodcut55, We just got word back from our researcher, Ed. On closer examination this does appear to be an exhibition of cut glass. It is possible this was part of a larger display which may have included china as well. The sign could be Crystallerie de (la) Pantin, a well known 19th-20th century glass maker. These types of items were exhibited in the Palace of Decorative Arts. www.flickr.com/photos/brooklyn_museum/2486824014/ www.flickr.com/photos/brooklyn_museum/2486859646/ Thanks for the comment!
